statements: SELECT * FROM customer_profiles WHERE age > 25
SELECT customer_name, location FROM customer_profiles WHERE gender = 'Female'
SELECT customer_name, age, location FROM customer_profiles ORDER BY age DESC
SELECT customer_name, email, phone_number FROM customer_profiles WHERE location IN ('New York', 'Los Angeles')
SELECT customer_id, customer_name, gender FROM customer_profiles
SELECT * FROM customer_profiles WHERE age > 30 ORDER BY customer_name ASC LIMIT 10
SELECT customer_name, location, phone_number FROM customer_profiles WHERE gender = 'Female' ORDER BY location DESC
SELECT customer_id, customer_name, age FROM customer_profiles WHERE location LIKE 'New%' ORDER BY age DESC
SELECT * FROM customer_profiles WHERE gender = 'Male' AND location = 'Los Angeles' ORDER BY customer_id ASC
SELECT customer_name, email FROM customer_profiles WHERE age BETWEEN 20 AND 40
SELECT * FROM customer_profiles WHERE age > 30
SELECT first_name, last_name, email FROM customer_profiles WHERE gender = 'Female'
SELECT * FROM customer_profiles WHERE city = 'New York'
SELECT customer_id, first_name, last_name, age FROM customer_profiles WHERE state = 'California'
SELECT * FROM customer_profiles WHERE age BETWEEN 20 AND 40
SELECT * FROM customer_profiles WHERE age > 30 ORDER BY last_name ASC;
SELECT first_name, last_name, email FROM customer_profiles WHERE gender = 'Female';
SELECT city, state FROM customer_profiles WHERE age BETWEEN 20 AND 40 AND gender = 'Male';
SELECT * FROM customer_profiles WHERE city LIKE 'New%';
SELECT segment_name, description FROM segmentations ORDER BY segment_id DESC;
SELECT * FROM customers;
SELECT first_name, last_name, email FROM customers;
SELECT customer_id, age, gender FROM customers WHERE age > 25;
SELECT segment_name, description FROM segments ORDER BY segment_name ASC;
SELECT c.first_name, c.last_name, s.segment_name FROM customers c JOIN customer_segments cs ON c.customer_id = cs.customer_id JOIN segments s ON cs.segment_id = s.segment_id;
SELECT * FROM customers WHERE age > 30 ORDER BY last_name ASC;
SELECT first_name, last_name, email FROM customers WHERE gender = 'Male';
SELECT customer_id, count(segment_id) as segment_count FROM customer_segments GROUP BY customer_id HAVING segment_count > 2;
SELECT segment_name, description FROM segments WHERE segment_id IN (1, 3, 5) ORDER BY segment_name DESC;
SELECT first_name, last_name, phone_number FROM customers WHERE address LIKE '%Street%' LIMIT 3;
SELECT * FROM customer_profiles;
SELECT id, name, gender FROM customer_profiles WHERE age > 30;
SELECT customer_id, location, income FROM demographic_data WHERE income > 50000;
SELECT id, segment_name FROM marketing_segments WHERE id IN (1, 3, 5);
SELECT cp.name, ms.segment_name FROM customer_profiles cp JOIN customer_segment_mapping csm ON cp.id = csm.customer_id JOIN marketing_segments ms ON csm.segment_id = ms.id;
SELECT * FROM customer_profiles LIMIT 5;
SELECT name, age, gender FROM customer_profiles WHERE age > 30 ORDER BY age DESC;
SELECT cp.name, cp.email, dd.location, dd.income FROM customer_profiles cp JOIN demographic_data dd ON cp.id = dd.customer_id WHERE dd.income > 50000;
SELECT cp.name, cs.segment_name FROM customer_profiles cp JOIN customer_segment_mapping csm ON cp.id = csm.customer_id JOIN marketing_segments cs ON csm.segment_id = cs.id;

SELECT cp.name, dd.location, cs.segment_name FROM customer_profiles cp JOIN demographic_data dd ON cp.id = dd.customer_id JOIN customer_segment_mapping csm ON cp.id = csm.customer_id JOIN marketing_segments cs ON csm.segment_id = cs.id ORDER BY cp.name DESC;
SELECT * FROM customers;
SELECT customer_id, first_name, last_name, email FROM customers ORDER BY last_name ASC;
SELECT customer_id, first_name, age, city, state FROM customers WHERE age > 30 AND city = 'New York';
SELECT customer_id, first_name, gender, city, state FROM customers WHERE gender = 'Female' OR state = 'California';
SELECT c.customer_id, c.first_name, p.product_name, p.price FROM customers c JOIN customer_preferences cp ON c.customer_id = cp.customer_id JOIN products p ON cp.prefered_product_id = p.product_id;
SELECT * FROM customers ORDER BY age DESC, first_name ASC
SELECT first_name, last_name, city, state FROM customers WHERE gender = 'Female'
SELECT customer_id, first_name, email, city, state FROM customers WHERE age > 30 AND city = 'New York'

SELECT c.first_name, c.last_name, p.product_name, p.price FROM customers c INNER JOIN customer_preferences cp ON c.customer_id = cp.customer_id INNER JOIN products p ON cp.prefered_product_id = p.product_id
SELECT c.customer_id, c.first_name, o.order_id, o.order_date, o.total_amount FROM customers c INNER JOIN orders o ON c.customer_id = o.customer_id ORDER BY o.order_date ASC
